doc.previous: The use of an angle-based length was first suggested by Edmund Gunter (of Gunter's chain fame).[18] During the 18th century, the relation of a mile of, 6000 (geometric) feet, or a minute of arc on the earth surface, had been advanced as a universal measure for land and sea. The metric kilometre was selected to represent a centisimal minute of arc, on the same basis, with the circle divided into 400 degrees of 100 minutes.[citation needed]
